newsitem.title: UK: NWE straight-run start week steady to weaker.
newsitem.headline: NWE straight-run start week steady to weaker.

text.p: European straight-run markets started the week quietly on Monday, assessed steady to a shade softer with few players coming into the market.

"The market is steady to a shade softer, with buyers in the high nineties," one trader said, adding it was not actively marketing, but would like to see $101 or $102 for its June 22-24 loader of 30kt low sulphur straight run.

Thin supply was met with little demand, traders said, adding that no one seems to have any immediate requirements. "It is a quiet market...No one has immediate requirements. There is not real buying interest," the trader said.

Crude's fall on Friday did not seem to have have a profound effect on straight-run as tight supply gave it support, traders said. One trader said there only two to three end-month cargoes available. --London newsroom, +44 171 542 8145
